Xilinx Processor IP Library

Software Drivers
Main Page | Data Structures | File List | Data Fields | Globals

xspi_l.h File Reference

Detailed Description

This header file contains identifiers, Register Definitions and basic driver functions (or macros) that can be used to access the device. Refer xspi.h for information about the driver.

 MODIFICATION HISTORY:

 Ver   Who  Date     Changes
 ----- ---- -------- -----------------------------------------------
 1.00b rpm  04/24/02 First release
 1.11a wgr  03/22/07 Converted to new coding style.
 1.11a sv   02/22/08 Added the definition of LSB-MSB first option.
 1.12a sv   03/28/08 Removed macros in _l.h file, moved the
                     interrupt register definitions from _i.h to _l.h.
 2.00a sv   07/30/08 Removed macros in _l.h file, moved the
                     interrupt register definitions from _i.h to _l.h.

Register offsets for the XSpi device.

#define XSP_DGIER_OFFSET

#define XSP_RFO_OFFSET

Global Interrupt Enable Register (GIER) mask(s)

#define XSP_GINTR_ENABLE_MASK

SPI Device Interrupt Status/Enable Registers

Interrupt Status Register (IPISR)

This register holds the interrupt status flags for the Spi device.

Interrupt Enable Register (IPIER)

This register is used to enable interrupt sources for the Spi device. Writing a '1' to a bit in this register enables the corresponding Interrupt. Writing a '0' to a bit in this register disables the corresponding Interrupt.

ISR/IER registers have the same bit definitions and are only defined once.

#define XSP_INTR_MODE_FAULT_MASK
#define XSP_INTR_SLAVE_MODE_FAULT_MASK
#define XSP_INTR_TX_EMPTY_MASK

Defines

Define Documentation

#define XSP_CR_CLK_PHASE_MASK
 

Clock phase 0 or 1

#define XSP_CR_CLK_POLARITY_MASK
 

Clock polarity high or low

#define XSP_CR_ENABLE_MASK
 

System enable

#define XSP_CR_LOOPBACK_MASK
 

Local loopback mode

#define XSP_CR_LSB_MSB_FIRST_MASK
 

LSB/MSB first data format select. The default data format is MSB first. The LSB first data format is not available in all versions of the Xilinx Spi Device whereas the MSB first data format is supported by all the versions of the Xilinx Spi Devices. Please check the HW specification to see if this feature is supported or not.

#define XSP_CR_MANUAL_SS_MASK
 

Manual slave sel assert

#define XSP_CR_MASTER_MODE_MASK
 

Enable master mode

#define XSP_CR_OFFSET
 

16-bit Control

#define XSP_CR_RXFIFO_RESET_MASK
 

Reset receive FIFO

#define XSP_CR_TRANS_INHIBIT_MASK
 

Master transaction inhibit

#define XSP_CR_TXFIFO_RESET_MASK
 

Reset transmit FIFO

#define XSP_DATAWIDTH_BYTE
 

Tx/Rx Reg is Byte Wide

#define XSP_DATAWIDTH_HALF_WORD
 

Tx/Rx Reg is Half Word (16 bit) Wide

#define XSP_DATAWIDTH_WORD
 

Tx/Rx Reg is Word (32 bit) Wide

#define XSP_DGIER_OFFSET
 

Global Intr Enable Reg

#define XSP_DRR_OFFSET
 

Data receive

#define XSP_DTR_OFFSET
 

Data transmit

#define XSP_GINTR_ENABLE_MASK
 

Global interrupt enable

#define XSP_IIER_OFFSET
 

Interrupt Enable Reg

#define XSP_IISR_OFFSET
 

Interrupt status Reg

#define XSP_INTR_ALL
 

Mask for all the interrupts in the IP Interrupt Registers.

#define XSP_INTR_DFT_MASK
 

The interrupts we want at startup. We add the TX_EMPTY interrupt in later when we're getting ready to transfer data. The others we don't care about for now.

#define XSP_INTR_MODE_FAULT_MASK
 

Mode fault error

#define XSP_INTR_RX_FULL_MASK
 

DRR/RxFIFO is full

#define XSP_INTR_RX_OVERRUN_MASK
 

DRR/RxFIFO was overrun

#define XSP_INTR_SLAVE_MODE_FAULT_MASK
 

Selected as slave while disabled

#define XSP_INTR_TX_EMPTY_MASK
 

DTR/TxFIFO is empty

#define XSP_INTR_TX_HALF_EMPTY_MASK
 

TxFIFO is half empty

#define XSP_INTR_TX_UNDERRUN_MASK
 

DTR/TxFIFO was underrun

#define XSP_RFO_OFFSET
 

8 bit Rx FIFO occupancy

#define XSP_SR_MODE_FAULT_MASK
 

Mode fault error

#define XSP_SR_OFFSET
 

8 Bit Status Register

#define XSP_SR_RX_EMPTY_MASK
 

Receive Reg/FIFO is empty

#define XSP_SR_RX_FULL_MASK
 

Receive Reg/FIFO is full

#define XSP_SR_TX_EMPTY_MASK
 

Transmit Reg/FIFO is empty

#define XSP_SR_TX_FULL_MASK
 

Transmit Reg/FIFO is full

#define XSP_SRR_OFFSET
 

Software Reset register

#define XSP_SRR_RESET_MASK
 

SPI Software Reset Register (SRR) mask.

#define XSP_SSR_OFFSET
 

32-bit slave select

#define XSP_TFO_OFFSET
 

8 bit Tx FIFO occupancy
